intro: Munnozia annua, commonly known as the annual muhly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It has slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Munnozia annua is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid environments.
